content.rendered:
Haridwar Travel Guide

Location: Uttarakhand, India
Population: 1,890,422
Religion: Hinduism 64.27 % | Islam 34.28 % | Sikhism 0.92 % | Christianity 0.26 % | Jainism 0.13 % | Buddhism 0.04 %
Area: 12.3 Km2 (4.7 sq mi)
Language: Hindi

Weather: 31° C - 10° C

Ideal Duration: 2-3 Days

Best Time: Feb-Oct

Nearest Airport: Dehradun

Welcome to the enchanting city of Haridwar. Cradled in the embrace of the Himalayan foothills. It’s not just a destination; it’s an invitation to a world where spirituality, history, and nature dance together. As you step into this ancient land, get ready for a journey that will weave unforgettable stories into the fabric of your soul. Feel the heartbeat of Haridwar as you witness the Ganga Aarti – a magical ritual where the river glows with countless oil lamps, and ancient hymns echo in the air. The sacred Ghats like Har Ki Pauri and Chandi Devi Temple become havens for reflection and spiritual renewal. Ganges’ holy waters flow through the city, creating an unspoken connection to something divine.

Follow the enticing scents of incense and spices through winding streets adorned with temples and lively markets. Dive into local delicacies, have heart-to-heart talks with the friendly locals, and witness the city’s living heritage during the Kumbh Mela – a spiritual gathering that transcends boundaries. For nature lovers, Haridwar Tourism offers new worlds with breathtaking natural views. During a stroll along the river banks or an excursion up to Rajaji National Park, nature lovers witness diverse species of flora and fauna.

Haridwar’s calendar is bursting with noisy festivals. The Kumbh Mela occurring every 12 years turns the city into an electric fair. And to complete the year, enjoy some Hindu celebrations that allow people all over age-old traditions. Now, visit the city of Haridwar and feel it with your senses. Meet its people, enjoy the diversity of sensational roadside food, or just immerse into Haridwar’s soul. Cross to the neighbourhood markets and purchase trinkets, each revealing tales of cultural riches.

Whether spiritual awakening, cultural deluge, or just an opportunity to dance with Mother Nature herself – Haridwar Tourism lures in people of every kind and all are called out on a journey that will forever be one’s memory. At the end of it all, it is a fairy that dies with one’s heart. Whatever attracts you – whether it is the calmness by the River Ganges, frenetic markets, or just the pure scenic beauty of nature – Haridwar’s Tourism will blow your heart away? This is not only the place, but a journey which then becomes some part of you. If you get a chance, then let Haridwar cast its fascinating spell on you and still for a long time to come it will remain in your memories.

About Haridwar

Haridwar, a city that is cradled in the lap of the Himalayas invites people to explore its tradition, temples, festivity, and natural beauty. As you travel through the old streets, Heritage wonders leave you spellbound to watch history there for centuries. It is not wrong to declare Haridwar, the best destination for temple tourism. The temples decorated with graceful carvings of entrancing shapes narrated tales about devotion and artistry. It compels you to wonder at the sheer grandeur of places such as Chandi Devi Temple and Daksheswara Mahadev Temple in awe with all those details.

The Ganges which is considered to be the holy river of Hinduism flows gently at Haridwar. In the mornings, by the Ghats, pilgrims watch the sacred rituals, and beautiful sunrise and listen to the divine chants. Both pilgrims and natives took their ritual baths in the sacred river, having faith that it was endowed with healing properties. The spirituality in the atmosphere would be palpable, making for a peaceful presence that permeated throughout the entire city.

Haridwar is not only a city, but one that lives to show traditions and festivals. It happened to be the time of the Kumbh Mela, a vast assemblage of pilgrims and wanderers from all over the globe. The city became a kaleidoscope of colours, sounds, and rites. The chanting of mantras reverberated through the air while all around were alive with zealous worshippers seeking to gain blessings and salvation. It is impossible to discuss Haridwar without touching upon its bustling markets on the streets. Starting with the busy Moti Bazaar to the more active Bara Bazaar, every market is a jewellery box of local handicrafts, spiritual artefacts, and traditional clothes. The vibrant interactions with shopkeepers showed that they were proud to represent the essence of cultural heritage in this city.

The Ganga Aarti at Har Ki Pauri makes the evenings of Haridwar a symphony with lights and spirituality. The coordinated dances of the priests, along with recitations done in chants coupled with fluttering flames emanating from Aarti lamps seduce us to witness this wonderful show. If you are looking for deep self-reflection and a divine encounter, Haridwar is a beautiful bliss to cherish forever.

Holiday Packages

Choose our Haridwar Tour Packages for a memorable Haridwar experience with your loved ones. Our Haridwar tour packages offer an unforgettable escape into the heart of spirituality and nature. We offer a wonderful tour of the divine heart of Har Ki Pauri, a spiritual spectacle by the Ganges, ancient temples of Mansa Devi, Chandi Devi, and soothing Ganga Ghats at a great price, without compromising on quality. We believe in making travel accessible to every wanderer. Our Haridwar Tour packages will enable you to experience the Ganga Ghats, participate in rituals, and embrace the vibrant culture of Haridwar without any hassle.

Things to Do

Haridwar is the best place if you want to immerse yourself in the spiritual and cultural allure of India. There are a plethora of things to do in Haridwar like embracing Ganga Aarti at Har Ki Pauri, temple hopping, exploring Ganga Ghats and floating Diyas, strolling through bustling markets, and tasting local delights. Haridwar Tourism will let you enter the heart of India’s rich Traditions, Spiritual beliefs, culture, and Heritage.
